page.title: 01 Beccles-Our Town.
page.content: Beccles was mentioned in the original Domesday Book and is still a small market town today.The River Waveney snakes around the town,forming the boundary between Norfolk and Suffolk. the town comprises many old buildings lanes and narrow alleys.The pop. is approx.9,000 and has grown slowly since 1945,mainly in a SE direction towards Worlingham.The Quay is very busy in summer and many holiday makers come via the river and the Broads. The most notable building is the detached tower of St Michaels.There is a large printing works and two industrial estates where the majority of people work.There is a new by-pass and they are trying to pedestrianise the centre.
